problem_text:
Let G be a finite group and p be a prime. Let Ψp,G be the class function of G which vanishes on all p-singular elements of G and whose value at each p-regular element x of G is the number of p-elements of CG(x).
(a) Is it true that Ψp,G is a character of G?
(b) If yes, can Ψp,G be afforded by a projective RG-module, where R is a complete discrete valuation ring of characteristic zero such that the field of fractions of R is a splitting field for G and its subgroups, and the residue field R/J(R) is a splitting field of characteristic p for G and its subgroups?
It is known that Ψp,G is a character when G ∼= Sn for any positive integer n and any prime p (T. Scharf, J. Algebra, 139, no. 2 (1991), 446–457).
G. Robinson
